quoteFirst: Its Twentieth Century Limited was in three sections, the Detroiter in two, Train Six in three. On these and two other trains due into the Grand Central Station between 8 and
quoteLast: , 1,200 persons were served with breakfast. This breakfast required sixteen dining-cars, eighty-two stewards, cooks, and assistants, and 105 waiters.
title: The Railroad Problem

quoteFirst: Lord Kitchener now threw himself into the task of concentrating and organising a relieving Army. He telegraphed at
quoteLast: on October 3 asking the French War Minister to make all preparations to send the proposed two divisions with cavalry and artillery complete as soon as possible and to let him know how soon they could be dispatched. He was asked in reply whether he would prefer one Territorial Division with a complete brigade of _Fusiliers Marins_.
title: The World Crisis, Volume 1 (of 6)
author: Churchill, Winston, 1874-1965

quoteLast: over a bridge on the right bank of the Bode. Altenbrack at 10.50, Wendefurth at 11.50. Rubeland reached at 2.30 P.M., and so on to Elbingerode, where a halt is made for the night at the 'Blauer Engel,' a tolerable inn. Women of burden and foresters are the only wayfarers met with.

quoteTime: forty minutes past nine in the morn
quoteLast: ing, a most violent shock of an earthquake was felt; its duration did not exceed six seconds; but so powerful was the concussion, that it overthrew every church and convent in the city, together with the royal palace, and the magnificent opera house adjoining to it; in short, no building of any consequence escaped.
title: The wonders of the world
